item.title: Addison's Disease
item.description: Primary adrenal cortical insufficiency - not enough steroid hormones Autoimmune is most common form Treat with long term steroid replacement Triad of hyperpigmentation, postural hypotension and hyponatraemia

item.title: Crystal Arthritis
item.description: Crystal arthropathies are a group of joint disorders caused by the formation and deposition of crystals within the joints. The two primary types are gout and pseudogout (calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease).

item.title: Inflammatory Arthritis
item.description: Usually the lining of the joint that gets affected Anyone at any age can get inflammatory arthritis Rheumatoid Arthritis ^ab6a7d A systemic autoimmune disorder affecting synovial joint membrane with extra-articular manifestations

item.title: Osteoarthritis
item.description: “Wear and tear” - nothing to do from immune system Cartilage flakes off Fragments of cartilage triggers slight inflammatory reaction Bone form cysts as tries to remodel Affects weight bearing joints

item.title: Psoriasis
item.description: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune skin disorder characterized by the buildup of skin cells, resulting in thick, scaly patches. It often involves redness, itching, and discomfort.

item.title: Sarcoidosis
item.description: Sarcoidosis is a rare inflammatory disease that can affect multiple organs, most commonly the lungs and lymph nodes. The condition is characterized by the formation of small clumps of inflammatory cells, known as granulomas, in various parts of the body.

item.title: Sjögren's syndrome
item.description: Sjögren’s Syndrome is a chronic autoimmune disorder characterized by inflammation and dysfunction of the exocrine glands, primarily the salivary and lacrimal glands.

item.title: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
item.description: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) is a complex autoimmune disease that can affect multiple organs and systems in the body. It is a Type III hypersensitivity reaction.
